'''Minecraft Celebrates the Community! (Yes, that means you!)''' is a celebration of the ''[[Minecraft]]'' community, made to commemorate the game achieving one trillion views on the video sharing platform {{Wikipedia|YouTube}}.<ref>{{Mcnet|youtube-celebrates-minecraft-community|YouTube Celebrates the Minecraft Community|December 15, 2021|[[Sofia Dankis]]}}</ref>

== Summary ==
The video opens in "[[Java Edition Classic 0.0.11a|Minecraft build 0.0.11a]], 2009" as a classic [[player]] builds with [[dirt]] blocks. A time traveler emerges from the ground with a shovel, asking "which build is this?" The classic player simply says "one of the first," causing the time traveler to take them down into a hole and sky dive into "Minecraft build 1.1???, present day." The classic player asks if the strange land they encountered is a DLC, only to be surprised when they find out it's actually built by ''Minecraft'' YouTubers, which have now generated a trillion views. The classic player is then revealed to be so old that they don't know what [[Breaking|mining]] is, asking why people are digging a big hole.

The Classic Player continues, asking where people learn their skills, remarking they couldn't find a tutorial. The time traveler simply replies there "is no tutorial for this level of creativity." They walk past a [[redstone]] contraption and both remark that it's dangerous. A sea of [[arrows]] fall from the sky, forcing them to take cover, only to be affected by an antigravity mod. They then pass a [[Nether Portal]] under construction, which the time traveler refers to as being built by a hack. The two then uncover a griefer burning down a house, which the classic player is horrified by and asks for the legality of. The classic player asks why to do all of this, and the time traveler explains the monetary incentives of being a YouTuber.

After arriving at a [[beach]] and bumping into a disappearing [[horse]], the classic player asks if "this was all part of [[Mojang]]'s plan." They are told no in a condescending manner, before another time traveler voiced by [[Jeb|Jens Bergensten]] emerges from the [[sand]] to propose showing the two the future.

== Trivia ==
{{Expand section|Identify the remainder of the references and structures}}

* Upon emerging in the present, the protagonists pass by a recreation of a build appearing in one of, if not, the earliest video of {{JE}} uploaded on YouTube.<ref>{{YouTube link|LEG9feKeQMY|minecraft|Jan Willem Nijman|May 17, 2009}}</ref>
* [[Grian]] makes an appearance flicking random [[Lever|levers]], which is a commonly associated of his, on what appears to be a reference to the video ''Wintergatan - Marble Machine in Minecraft''.<ref>{{YouTube link|a_QgyahFHYk|Wintergatan - Marble Machine in Minecraft|„ÇÜ„Åã„ÅµMC|February 13, 2018}}</ref>
* [[CaptainSparklez]] makes an appearance, dancing at the music studio with creepers referencing his ''Minecraft'' music parody ''Revenge''.<ref>{{YouTube link|cPJUBQd-PNM|"Revenge" - A Minecraft Parody of Usher's DJ Got Us Fallin' In Love (Music Video)|[[CaptainSparklez]]|August 19, 2011}}</ref>
* The hole being dug by dwarves is a direct reference to a music video by the group {{Wikipedia|Yogscast}}.<ref>{{YouTube link|ytWz0qVvBZ0|‚ô™ Diggy Diggy Hole|The Yogscast|July 11, 2014}}</ref>
* In the back of the village is a ginormous, horror-themed roller coaster, referencing one based off ''{{Wikipedia|The Nightmare Before Christmas}}''.<ref>{{YouTube link|rJqNV5sZxBo|The Night Rail Before Christmas: A Nightmare Before Christmas Minecraft Roller Coaster|Nuropsych1|August 31, 2013}}</ref>
** Another creation by the same creator, based off the film ''{{Wikipedia|Beetlejuice}}'', had previously received an article on the Mojang website.<ref>{{YouTube link|afcudstM9zA|Beetle Juice - A Minecraft Roller Coaster|Nuropsych1|March 16, 2013}}</ref><ref>{{Citation|url=http://www.mojang.com/2013/03/take-a-ride-on-this-beetle-juice-roller-coaster/|title=Ride on the Minecraft Beetlejuice roller coaster!|author=[[Owen Jones|Owen]]|website=Mojang|date=March 22, 2013|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130330192827/http://www.mojang.com/2013/03/take-a-ride-on-this-beetle-juice-roller-coaster/}}</ref>
* YouTuber and Twitch streamer {{w|Philza}} makes an appearance running from a baby zombie, referencing how one of his longest running [[hardcore]] worlds ended during a fight with one.<ref>{{YouTube link|C0B-y61mn8g|I DIED IN HARDCORE AFTER 5 YEARS (Update 2019)|Ph1LzA|April 30, 2019}}</ref><ref>{{Citation|url=https://www.pcgamesn.com/minecraft/philza-death|title=World record Minecraft hardcore run killed after five years by a baby zombie|author=Dustin Bailey|website=PCGamesN|date=April 29, 2019}}</ref>
* The late YouTuber [[Technoblade]] makes an appearance driving an invisible car, referencing his video of beating ''Minecraft'' with a steering wheel.<ref>{{YouTube link|S6nHpjUpIts|beating minecraft hardcore mode with a steering wheel|[[Technoblade]]|July 11, 2017}}</ref>
* While passing by Technoblade, if one looks closely they can see the surrounding biomes distorting. This is a direct reference to the video Acid Interstate, which was made to test and promote a [[shader]].<ref>{{YouTube link|geGziPUQD2U|Minecraft Acid Interstate V3|MiningGodBruce|August 26, 2016}}</ref>
* The wolf killing the ender dragon with a button is Max, the dog of YouTuber {{Wikipedia|Liam Thompson (YouTuber)|Liam Thompson}}, who he successfully "taught" to play the game.<ref>{{YouTube link|Ycpze43FDTA|I Taught My Dog to Play Minecraft|Liam Thompson|September 30, 2019}}</ref><ref>{{Citation|url=https://www.dexerto.com/entertainment/youtuber-teaches-dog-how-play-minecraft-1084166/|title=YouTuber teaches his dog how to play Minecraft|author=Brent Koepp|website=Dextero|date=October 1, 2019}}</ref>
* A [[sign]] labeled "hey come check out our cool bunker" can be seen by Max, referencing a quote from a Yogscast video on the Voltz modpack.<ref>{{YouTube link|F2ohslGivm8|Voltz Special - Episode 12 - The Bomb|The Yogscast|February 21, 2013}}</ref>
* The presence of arrows raining from the sky could be a reference to several potential videos, most likely one released in 2011, or another by {{Wikipedia|MrBeast}}.<ref>{{YouTube link|Q9iYylYV3Ds|Minecraft: Arrow Rain|erikvader08|March 4, 2011}}</ref><ref>{{YouTube link|Db-rqtQw7Nw|Minecraft But It's Raining Arrows!|MrBeast Gaming|July 10, 2020}}</ref>{{Verify}}
* While falling, an excerpt of the song ''Dragonhearted'' by CaptainSparklez can be heard.<ref>{{YouTube link|07rtl-zcQhg|"Dragonhearted" - A Minecraft Original Music Video|[[CaptainSparklez]]|November 19, 2016}}</ref>
* An incomplete model of the {{Wikipedia|Starship Enterprise|Starship ''Enterprise''}} is visible in the sky, referencing a "megastructure" of it that was constructed in [[Pocket Edition]].<ref>{{YouTube link|kn2-d5a3r94|Building Megaobjects in Minecraft|Halkun|September 27, 2010}}</ref><ref>{{YouTube link|7TZcW8wmmo4|Minecraft with Gadget by Mike Matei|Cinemassacre Clips|May 9, 2020}}</ref>
* A visual gag of a sign labeled "speedrunner x-ing" is present under the Enterprise.
* A player can be seen canceling fall damage by quickly exiting a world and returning, a notorious glitch.<ref>{{Bug|MC-212|3=Fall damage is ignored for a couple of seconds when reloading into LAN or singleplayer worlds}}</ref>
* YouTuber Keralis makes an appearance at a stand.
* The disappearing horse is a reference to Jorgen, the first horse {{Wikipedia|PewDiePie}} tamed in his playthrough, who ended up disappearing.<ref>{{YouTube link|k1mAqt9yKYY|I LOST my horse in Minecraft (REAL TEARS) - Part 4|PewDiePie|June 27, 2019}}</ref><ref>{{YouTube link|B344MieBbXU|Pewdiepie Loses Joergen (Minecraft Animation)|TeamWnJ|July 15, 2019}}</ref>
* During the final scene, the [[Far Lands]] can be seen in the distance.
